intro: Mauria ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf mauria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are oval-shaped and often have a mild, spicy scent. Mauria ovalifolia is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
